abstract.text: Creates a graphics context to draw the preview in.

inlineContent.text: Use a QLPreviewingController in a Preview Extension to provide previews for your file types.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

platforms.message: Use a QLPreviewingController in a Preview Extension to provide previews for your file types.
platforms.name: macOS

inlineContent.text: The preview request object.
The size of the preview; if
is
the size is in pixels, otherwise it’s in points.
if the preview uses a bitmap-based graphics context,
otherwise. This value of this parameter affects the interpretation of the
parameter.
A dictionary containing properties for the preview response.
lists the current property keys and describes their values.
A Core Graphics graphics-context object that you can draw your preview image in. You should explicitly release this object when it is no longer needed.
You can directly draw your preview data in the graphics-context object created by this function. After calling this function, you should flush the context with
. Also be sure to release the
object.

Quick Look provides three types of graphics contexts for drawing previews: bitmap, single-page vector-based, and multi-page vector-based (for PDF previews). You use this function to acquire a context for bitmap and single-page vector drawing; the
parameter is used to distinguish between them. For multi-page contexts, use the
function.
If you prefer to work in Objective-C code, you can convert the created
to a
object using
Thread-safety: This function should be called in the same thread as the preview request is made in; generally, this is the same thread in which the
callback was invoked.

abstract.text: An object that represents a graphics context.
Creates a new graphics context from the specified graphics port.
A Quartz 2D drawing environment.
Create previews of files to use inside your app, or perform simple edits on previews.
An opaque reference that represents a preview request object.
Returns the UTI for the preview request.
Returns the options specified for the preview request.
Returns the URL of the document for which a preview is requested.
Creates a graphics context to draw the preview in.
Creates a PDF context suitable to draw a multi-page preview.
Flush the context and sets the preview response.
Returns the object that’s stored as part of a preview request.
Get the bundle of the generator receiving the preview request.
Gets the type identifier for the
opaque type.
Returns whether the preview request has been cancelled by the client.
Sets the preview request to data saved within the document or to dynamically generated data.
Stores an object as part of a preview request.
Sets the contents of the file at the given URL as the response to the preview request.
A structure that contains width and height values.
A reference to an immutable dictionary object.
A Quartz 2D drawing environment.
A value type whose instances are either `true` or `false`.
A type for propagating an unmanaged object reference.
